titleStmt.title: A pleasant satyre or poesie wherein is discouered the Catholicon of Spayne, and the chiefe leaders of the League. Finelie fetcht ouer, and laide open in their colours. Newly turned out of French into English.
Satyre Ménippée. English.
titleStmt.author: T. W. (Thomas Wilcox), 1549?-1608, attributed name.
Leroy, Pierre, Canon of Rouen.
T. W., fl. 1573-1595.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the widdow Orwin for Thomas Man, dwelling in Pater-noster row at the signe of the Talbot,

notesStmt.note: A translation of "Satyre Menippée de la vertu du Catholicon d'Espagne" by Pierre Leroy and others.
Signed by the translator on 2A1v: T.W., i.e. Thomas Wilcox?.
Running title reads: A satyre Menippized.
Variant: with an inserted half-sheet, signed [par.], with an epistle from T. M[an]., stationer to J.B., merchant.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
